ud2.10:7.3_0: “Formerly, as a lay person ruling the land, my guard was well organized within and without the royal compound, within and without the city, and within and without the country.
ud2.10:7.4_0: But although I was guarded and defended in this way, I remained fearful, scared, suspicious, and nervous.
ud2.10:7.5_0: But these days, even when alone in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, I’m not fearful, scared, suspicious, or nervous. I live relaxed, unruffled, surviving on charity, my heart free as a wild deer.
